{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2017}} {{Use Indian English|date=June 2017}} {{Infobox recurring event | name = 350th Prakash Parv
३५०वा प्रकाश पर्व | native_name = ੩੫੦ ਸਾਲਾ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਸ਼ ਪੁਰਬ | native_name_lang = Punjabi | logo = 350th Prakash Parv.png | logo_alt = | logo_caption = | logo_size =200px | image = Khanda Patna Sahib.jpg | image_size =200px | alt = | caption = Khanda, Patna Sahib | status = | genre = | date = | begins = {{start date|df=yes|2016|12|30}} | ends = {{end date|df=yes|2017|01|05}}{{cite web|author=Dev Raj |url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160916/jsp/bihar/story_108444.jsp#.V9xKzFt97IU |title=Nitish announces three-day holiday for Sikh celebrations |publisher=Telegraphindia.com |date=1999-03-01 |accessdate=2016-09-16}} | frequency = | venue = [[Takht Sri Patna Sahib]], [[Patna City]] | location = [[Patna]], [[Bihar]] | coordinates = | country = India | years_active = | first = | founder_name = | last = | prev = | next = | participants = | attendance = | capacity = | area = | budget = | activity = | leader_name = | patron = | organised = Tourism Department, [[Government of Bihar]] | filing = | people = | member = | sponsor = | website = {{URL|prakashparv.com}} | footnotes = }} The '''350th Prakash Parv''' (also Prakash Utsav) or birth anniversary of [[Guru Gobind Singh]] ji was celebrated in January 2017 in [[Patna]], India.http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/Prakash-Parv-350th-birth-anniversary-of-Guru-Gobind-Singh/article16992046.ece 2017 is the year of the 350th anniversary of the 10th [[Sikh]] Guru, a [[Spirituality|spiritual master]], [[warrior]], [[poet]] and [[philosopher]]. At the date of this anniversary, a number of events was organized on the occasion in [[Patna]] marking a grand celebration in their history.{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/govt-to-celebrate-birth-anniversary-of-guru-gobind-singh/article8804177.ece |title=Govt. to celebrate birth anniversary of Guru Gobind Singh |publisher=The Hindu |date=2016-07-03 |accessdate=2016-09-16}} ==Development and preparation== Just as the construction of the over-bridge, which connects Guru Gobind Path with the National Highway is undergoing{{cite web|url=http://patnasahib.in/takhat-prakash-utsav-2017.php |title=Takhat Prakash Utsav 2017 - 350th Birth Anniversary of Guru Gobind Singh |publisher=Patnasahib.in |date= |accessdate=2016-09-16}} for the 350th anniversary of Guru Gobind Singh, several major construction projects have been undertaken for the 350th anniversary celebrations.{{cite web|author=Share on FacebookShare on Twitter |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/patna/350th-Prakash-Parv-CM-seeks-Rs-500-crore-from-Centre/articleshow/53244861.cms |title=350th Prakash Parv: CM seeks Rs 500 crore from Centre - Times of India |publisher=Timesofindia.indiatimes.com |date=2016-07-16 |accessdate=2016-09-16}} *The roads and bylanes which connects to [[Gurdwara Kangan Ghat]] in the Patna City area, situated on the bank of river [[Ganges]] is hardly 200 yards from Takht Sri Patna Sahib, are undergoing a major facelift{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/chandigarh/massive-revamp-plan-underway-at-patna-for-350th-birth-anniversary-of-guru/story-kfsKKJOYurSmlq3yWYqzhL.html |title=Massive revamp plan underway at Patna for 350th birth anniversary of Guru | chandigarh |publisher=Hindustan Times |date= |accessdate=2016-09-16}} *A temporary tent city spanning over 75 acres is to be set up on the banks of Ganga near Kangan Ghat{{cite web|url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/india/badals-visit-patna-review-arrangements-for-350th-parkash-utsav-of-guru-gobind-singh/story-e4ldhejc3nalKoJ3Jv4uYP.html |title=Badals review arrangements for 350th Parkash Utsav of Guru Gobind Singh | india |publisher=Hindustan Times |date=2015-12-18 |accessdate=2016-09-16}} *The [[Indian Railways]] is re-opening Patna Ghat railway station between {{rws|Patna Sahib}} and {{rws|Gulzarbagh}} to clear the rush.[https://www.telegraphindia.com/1161221/jsp/bihar/story_125831.jsp 154 years Patna ghat] It has also constructed a new road overbridge near Chowk Shikarpur on main line.{{cite web|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/shuttle-to-carry-sikh-pilgrims-in-patna-116012101247_1.html |title=Shuttle to carry Sikh Pilgrims in Patna | Business Standard News |publisher=Business-standard.com |date=2016-01-21 |accessdate=2016-09-16}}{{cite web|url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160625/jsp/bihar/story_93107.jsp |title=Sikh pride |publisher=Telegraphindia.com |date=2016-06-25 |accessdate=2016-09-16}} *Several tourist information centres would be opened in Patna{{cite web|author=Share on FacebookShare on Twitter |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/patna/Nitish-reviews-preps-for-350th-Prakash-Utsav/articleshow/53127723.cms |title=Nitish reviews preps for 350th Prakash Utsav - Times of India |publisher=Timesofindia.indiatimes.com |date=2016-07-09 |accessdate=2016-09-16}} *200 [[CCTV]] cameras will be installed to monitor the situationhttps://www.punjabupdate.com/2016/01/15/350th-parkash-utsav-of-sri-guru-gobind-singh-ji-to-be-celebrated-on-a-grand-scale *The ''Gurudwara Prabandhak Committee'' (gurdwara management committee) is also undertaking huge constructions and renovations on its campus. *Multiple tent cities have been planned across Patna under the aegis of Department of Tourism, Government of Bihar, with the main celebrations being conducted at [[Gandhi Maidan]].{{cite web|author=Share on FacebookShare on Twitter |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/patna/Punjab-chief-secy-to-meet-Bihar-officials-to-review-preparations-of-Guru-Gobind-Singhs-birth-anniv/articleshow/53025613.cms |title=Punjab chief secy to meet Bihar officials to review preparations of Guru Gobind Singh's birth anniv - Times of India |publisher=Timesofindia.indiatimes.com |date=2016-07-02 |accessdate=2016-09-16}} *On 16 September 2016, [[Nitish Kumar]], chief minister of Bihar, declared a three-day public holiday in Patna from 3 to 5 January 2017. [[File:TheJoyof350thAnniversary@IncredibleIndia.jpg|thumb|Takht Sri Patna Sahib during 350th Prakash Parv]] ===Host city=== [[Patna]], the capital city of [[Bihar]] is the birthplace of Shri [[Guru Gobind Singh]] ji and host city for 350th anniversary celebrations. Most of the celebrations is scheduled to take place in the neighbourhood of [[Patna City]], close to [[Takht Sri Patna Sahib]] Gurudwara. The famous Takht Sri Patna Sahib Gurudwara is an important shrine for [[Sikh]]s from all over the world. Patna Sahib is considered to be the second most important Takhat, according to religious importance. Patna City is the old area of Patna, located on the eastern side of the state capital. The [[Government of Bihar]] hosted the first ever International Sikh Conclave from 22 to 24 September 2016.{{cite web|author=Share on FacebookShare on Twitter |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/patna/400-to-take-part-in-intl-Sikh-conclave-in-Patna/articleshow/54352993.cms |title=400 to take part in int'l Sikh conclave in Patna - Times of India |publisher=Timesofindia.indiatimes.com |date= |accessdate=2016-09-16}} ==Funding== Together, municipal,{{cite web|author=Piyush Kumar Tripathi |url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1160807/jsp/bihar/story_101034.jsp |title=Welcome gates for Sikh fest |publisher=Telegraphindia.com |date=2016-08-07 |accessdate=2016-09-16}} provincial and federal levels, that is, all three levels of federal government is contributing funds for the events and new infrastructure planned for the celebrations. In September 2014, officials of the Takht Shri Patna Saheb said NRIs and businessmen from across world will contribute {{INRConvert|600|c|0}} to develop Harmandir Saheb.{{cite web|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/2014/20140915/latest-news.htm#8 |title=The Tribune, Chandigarh, India - Latest News |publisher=Tribuneindia.com |date=2012-07-18 |accessdate=2016-09-16}} In February 2016, [[Ministry of Finance (India)|Union Finance Ministry]] allocated a package of {{INRConvert|100|c|0}} for the celebrations.{{cite web|author=By ECONOMICTIMES.COM |url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/economy/policy/budget-2016-highlights-of-fm-arun-jaitleys-speech/articleshow/51186309.cms |title=Budget 2016: Highlights of FM Arun Jaitley's speech - The Economic Times |publisher=Economictimes.indiatimes.com |date=2016-02-29 |accessdate=2016-09-16}} The Bihar government on 16 September 2016 said, it will spend {{INRConvert|100|c|0}} on the arrangements and the celebrations. ==Exhibition== Panjab Digital Library in collaboration with Bihar Government has organised an exhibition, "Emperor-Prophet Guru Gobind Singh Sahib" at Bihar Museum, Patna. The exhibition was inaugurated by Shri Shiv Chander Ram, Hon'ble Minister Department of Art, Culture & Youth on 30 December. It is open to public till 31 December 2017. After that it will be taken to different museums of Bihar. Focus of the exhibit is the digitized heritage of Panjab that elucidate various interesting facets of this glorious era. The heritage speaks for itself explaining history events and original circumstances as they unfolded. The exhibit displays all the major events related to Guru Gobind Singh ji’s eventful life from 1666 to 1708. Put in a systematic order, on display are copies of different historical paintings, miniatures, forts, rare pictures detailing the life of Guru Sahib and coins issued in his name during the Khalsa Raj, all accompanied by descriptions and text on panels detailing their significance. It not only brings to life the complete sequence of events as it happened but also how he revolutionized the society. ==See also== {{portal|Sikhism|Patna|Bihar|Punjab}} *[[Patna Sahib Mahotsav]] *[[Sikhism]] ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Anniversaries]] [[Category:January 2017 events in India]] [[Category:Patna]] [[Category:Sikhism]]

[[File:Typical Arbëreshë female costumes.jpg|thumb|Albanian folk dance from [[Civita, Calabria|Civita]], [[Calabria]], [[Italy]]]]
'''Albanology''' is an interdisciplinary branch of the humanities that addresses the [[Albanian language|language]], [[Traditional Albanian clothing|costume]], [[Albanian literature|literature]], [[Art of Albania|art]], [[Albanian culture|culture]] and [[History of Albania|history]] of [[Albanians]]. Within the studies the scientific methods of literature, linguistics, archeology, history and culture are used. However the [[Albanian language]] is the main point of research of the studies.
== Studies ==
[[File:Theodor Ippen-Albanian costume.jpg|thumb|Austrian [[Theodor Ippen]] in [[Shkodër]] with traditional costume. (1900)]]
[[Johann Erich Thunmann]] in the 18th century was probably the first Albanologist. He supported the theory of the autochthony of the [[Albanians]]<ref>{{cite book|last=Elsie|first=Robert|authorlink=Robert Elsie|title=Historical Dictionary of Albania|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=haFlGXIg8uoC&pg=PA159|date=19 March 2010|publisher=Scarecrow Press|isbn=978-0-8108-7380-3|page=159|quote= Johann Erich Thunmann (1746–1778) of the University of Halle first disseminated the theory of the autochthony of the Albanians}}</ref> and also presented the [[Illyrians|Illyrian]] origin theory.<ref name="Schwandner-SieversFischer2002">{{cite book|last1=Schwandner-Sievers|first1=Stephanie|last2=Fischer|first2=Bernd Jürgen|authorlink2=Bernd Jürgen Fischer|title=Albanian Identities: Myth and History|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=oRASDq3rc-YC&pg=PA75|year=2002|publisher=Indiana University Press|isbn=0-253-34189-2|page=75|quote=Although the first major exposition of the Illyrian theory, published by the German scholar Johann Thunmann in 1774...}}</ref><ref name="Stipčević1977">{{cite book|last=Stipčević|first=Aleksandar|authorlink=Aleksandar Stipčević|title=The Illyrians: history and culture|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=NLcWAQAAIAAJ|year=1977|publisher=Noyes Press|isbn=978-0-8155-5052-5|page=73|quote=The first one who clearly formulated the thesis of the Illyrian origin of the Albanians, was the German historian Johannes Thunmann in the eighteenth century.}}</ref> Later on [[Gustav Meyer]] proved that Albanian language was part of the [[Indo-European languages|Indo-European family]].<ref name="Baldi1983">{{cite book|author=Philip Baldi|title=An Introduction to the Indo-European Languages|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=lq-mkL23oh8C&pg=PA88|year=1983|publisher=SIU Press|isbn=978-0-8093-1091-3|pages=87–88|quote=In fact, Albanian was not established definitively Indo-European until the latter part of the nineteenth century, when certain structural and lexical correspondences that demonstrated the Indo-European character of the language were noted (especially by Gustav Meyer)}}</ref>
In the 20th century such studies were deepened by [[Norbert Jokl]], [[Milan Šufflay]], and [[Franz Nopcsa von Felső-Szilvás]], as well as [[Karl Reinhold]], and [[Eqrem Çabej]].
The studies of Albanology were more institutionally supported in Albania starting in 1940 with the opening of the [[Royal Institute of the Albanian Studies]], which had preceded the [[Academy of Sciences of Albania]], opened in 1972. Meanwhile, during the 1960s, the [[Albanology Institute of Pristina]] was also reconstructed in [[Kosovo]], then part of [[Yugoslavia]].<ref name="Shetuni2011">{{cite book|author=Spiro J. Shetuni|title=Albanian Traditional Music: An Introduction, with Sheet Music and Lyrics for 48 Songs|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=SjasqxAeHXAC&pg=PA17|year=2011|publisher=McFarland|isbn=978-0-7864-8630-4|page=17|quote=In the 1960s, the Albanology Institute of Prishtinë was founded in Kosovo. }}</ref> The institute emerged from its core founded in 1953.<ref name="Elsie2010">{{cite book|author=Robert Elsie|title=Historical Dictionary of Kosovo|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Pg-aeA-nUeAC&pg=PA26|date=15 November 2010|publisher=Scarecrow Press|isbn=978-0-8108-7483-1|page=26|quote= The core of the present Albanological Institute was founded on 1 June 1953 with four staff members: Ilhami Nimani, Selman Riza,}}</ref>
== Notable Albanologists == {{refimprove|date=October 2018}} {{columns-list|colwidth=22em| * [[Johann Erich Thunmann]] (1746–1778) * [[Johann Georg von Hahn]] (1811–1869) * [[Girolamo de Rada]] (1814–1903) * [[Demetrio Camarda]] (1821–1882) * [[Vinkentij Makušev]] (1837–1883) * [[Gustav Meyer]] (1850–1900) * [[Ludwig von Thallóczy]] (1854–1916) * [[Theodor Ippen]] (1861–1935) * [[Edith Durham]] (1863–1944) * [[Carl Patsch]] (1865–1945) * [[Nicolae Iorga]] (1871–1940) * [[Georg Pekmezi]] (1872–1938) * [[Norbert Jokl]] (1877–1942) * [[Franz Nopcsa von Felső-Szilvás]] (1877–1933) * [[Milan Šufflay|Milan von Šufflay]] (1879–1931) * [[Marie Amelie von Godin]] (1882–1956) * [[Maximilian Lambertz]] (1882–1963) * [[Margaret Hasluck]] (1885–1948) * [[Giuseppe Valentini (albanologist)|Giuseppe Valentini]] (1900–1979) * [[Eqrem Çabej]] (1908–1980) * [[Namik Resuli]] (1908–1985) * [[Georg Stadtmüller]] (1909–1985) * [[Eric P. Hamp]] (born 1920) * [[Shaban Demiraj]] (1920–2014) * [[Martin Camaj]] (1925–1992) * [[Aleksandar Stipčević]] (1930–2015) * [[Peter Schubert]] (1938–2003; last ambassador from [[East Germany]] in Tirana) * [[Robert Elsie]] (1950-2017) * [[Vladimir Orel]] (1952–2007) * [[Marko Snoj]] (born 1959) * [[Oliver Schmitt]] (born 1973) * [[Ranko Matasovic]] (born 1968) }}
==See also== *[[List of Albanologists]] *[[Historiography of Albania]] *[[Balkan studies]]

[[File:Baseball Cheering .jpg|thumb|391x391px | Baseball cheering taking place at Suwon KT wiz ballpark]] The '''baseball cheering culture in South Korea''' started in the 1990s and continues to the present.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://blog.naver.com/iw99106/220776033445|title=한국 야구 응원 문화|last=|first=|date=2016-07-31|website=blog.naver.com|language=ko|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-11-19}}</ref> There are [[KBO League#Teams|10 professional clubs]] and each club has its own way of cheering.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.khan.co.kr/kh_news/khan_art_view.html?artid=201503291857115&code=960801|title=한국 야구 팬들의 열정 넘치는 응원 현장|last=허|first=남설|date=2015-03-29|work=The Kyunghyang Shinmun|access-date=2017-11-20|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=ko}}</ref> The Korean cheering culture generally shares similar characteristics: collective, enthusiastic and empathetic. Baseball cheering is popular among women because of the easy-to-learn melodies of fight songs, break-time events and a variety of foods. Baseball cheering is performed in most parts of a [[Baseball park|ballpark]].<ref name="nytimes_2014-11-03"/><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://blog.naver.com/openlabseoul/220029353959|title=즐거운 소란, 프로야구 응원 재개 - 한국의 스포츠 응원문화|last=|first=|date=2014-06-16|website=blog.naver.com|language=ko|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref><ref name="abcnews_50817262"/>
== Cheering methods ==
=== Fight songs === Korean baseball [[Fight song|fight songs]] consist of the song for each club and songs for individual players.<ref name="nytimes_2014-11-03"/><ref name="abcnews_50817262"/> The fight song is a key element of Korea's baseball cheering culture. Cheering is done for the offence. Each batter has a personal fight song, sung when the batter enters the [[Baseball field#Batter's box and catcher's box|batter's box]]. The melodies of fight songs are taken from famous pop songs or K-pop songs, with lyrics rewritten to make it easy for the crowd to sing along. There are cell phone mobile applications that allow baseball fans to listen to the fight songs of clubs and players in advance.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.yonhapnews.co.kr/bulletin/2016/07/11/0200000000AKR20160711156500007.HTML|title=보크는 몰라도, 응원가는 술술 나와요|last=이|first=대호|date=2016-07-16|work=Yonhap News|access-date=2017-11-20|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=ko-KR}}</ref>
=== Cheering tools === In the early days of [[KBO League|Korea's professional baseball league]], which was started in 1982, the most commonly used cheering tools were Korean traditional musical instruments, such as [[Buk (drum)|Buk]], [[Jing (instrument)|Jing]], and [[Kkwaenggwari]]. But nowadays, a typical example of a cheering tool is cylindrical, inflatable balloon sticks, now commonly known in the English-speaking world as [[thundersticks]]. They are used for cheering by beating a pair of balloon sticks together to make a loud sound.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=http://news.donga.com/BestClick/3/all/20081027/8649242/1#csidx9dee7f5be08905c901a0829c675f7ff|title=전태수 사장이 밝히는 막대풍선의 역사|last=이|first=길상|date=2009-09-23|work=dongA.com,|access-date=2017-11-20|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=ko}}</ref><ref name="nytimes_2014-11-03"/> The first club in the world to introduce balloon sticks was the [[LG Twins]].<ref name=":0"/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/06/15/magazine/who-made-that-inflatable-noisemaker.html|title=Who Made That Inflatable Noisemaker?|first=Daniel|last=Engber|date=13 June 2014|accessdate=18 January 2018|work=[[The New York Times]]}}</ref> In the early 1990s they made balloon sticks out of [[polyethylene]]. It has been evolving and now it is recyclable, as the sticks can be inflated for use then deflated for storage until the next game.<ref name=":0" /><ref name="abcnews_50817262"/>
Each club has its own color for the balloon sticks: [[SK Wyverns]] is red, [[Samsung Lions]] is blue, [[Doosan Bears]] is white, [[Kia Tigers]] is yellow, [[LG Twins]] is red, [[Nexen Heroes]] is pink and [[Hanwha Eagles]] is orange. <ref name="Korean Culture and Information Service">Pg 71 - {{cite book |ref=harv|last2=Won Hee-bok|last=Korean Culture and Information Service|first=| authorlink = Korean Culture and Information Service| title = K-SPORTS A New Breed of Rising Champions|year=2012| publisher = [[Korea.net]]| isbn= 9788973755653|language=ENGLISH }} <small>- Total pages: 108 </small></ref>
Another interesting characteristic of Korean baseball cheering is fans wearing team uniform shirts with players' names.<ref name="abcnews_50817262"/> They wear this to feel a sense of belonging, solidarity and pride. Symbolic accessories and cheering tools play a similar role. There are stores in each stadium, so it is easy for supporters to buy cheer-related items.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailyesports.com/view.php?ud=2017081721533583157|title=MD 상품과 e스포츠 응원 문화|last=|first=|date=2017-08-18|work=Daily e-sports|access-date=2017-11-20|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=ko}}</ref>
=== Cheer leaders === The [[Korea Baseball Organization]] did not have standardized cheering methods until the 1990s. It was the audiences who became the initiators of cheering. The initial ways of cheering were clapping and spontaneous singing. But in time, official cheer leaders appeared.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://star.ohmynews.com/NWS_Web/OhmyStar/at_pg.aspx?CNTN_CD=A0002307409|title=막대풍선 들고 "와와"... 프로야구 응원, 좀 바꿉시다|date=2017-03-16|website=오마이스타|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref> Cheer leaders and cheer leading captain are the ones who take the lead. Each club has one captain and four or five cheer leaders. Cheer leaders dance to the chant the captain is making. Basically, they start cheering with the club's fight songs, but sometimes they lead the cheering using the latest [[K-pop]] songs.<ref name=":1" /><ref name="abcnews_50817262"/>
== Cheering features of each stadium ==
=== Foods === Each stadium has specialty food associated with cheering. A typical example of baseball stadium food is "[[Chimaek]]," which is fried chicken and beer.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.hankookilbo.com/v/dd2123d4ed992ad5710750cfbae4414b|title=야구장서 치맥파티... 하루 1000마리 날개 돋친 듯|work=한국일보|access-date=2017-11-20|language=ko}}</ref> There are various kinds of cheering foods featured at each [[Baseball park|ballpark]]. These are often the representative foods of the region where the ballpark is located. In [[Daegu]] [[Samsung Lions Ballpark|Samsung Lions Park]], there are Napjak Mandu (flat grilled [[dumpling]]s),<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://jmagazine.joins.com/forbes/view/318614|title=야구장 엔터테인먼트는 ‘춘추전국시대’|date=2017-10-23|work=중앙시사매거진|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref> [[Samgyeopsal]] (Korean-style bacon) and [[kebab]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.fnnews.com/news/201104092323329794?t=y|title=[이슈가 Money?] 치어리더 쟁탈전..지정석 1만원|date=2011-04-10|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref> In [[Busan]] [[Busan Sajik Baseball Stadium|Sajik Stadium]], Buljokbal (spicy [[Jokbal]]), Bulgopchang (spicy [[Gopchang]])<ref name="hankookilbo_96bb20ad4eb4b04880cf4e4b76d10d9"/> and [[fast food]]<nowiki/>s such as [[hamburger]]s and [[fried chicken]]. In [[Seoul]] [[Jamsil Baseball Stadium|Jamsil Stadium]], [[Jokbal]] ([[pig's trotters]]), in [[Gwangju]] [[Gwangju-Kia Champions Field|Kia Champions Field]], [[Garak-guksu|Garak Guksu]] (boiled thin noodles in dried [[anchovy]] broth),<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://lady.khan.co.kr/khlady.html?mode=view&code=11&artid=201205101808581&pt=nv|title=‘야구 초보’ 당신을 위한 2012 프로야구 친절 설명서|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref> in [[Daejeon Hanbat Baseball Stadium|Hanwha Life Insurance Eagles Park]], in Jinmi [[Tongdak]] and in [[Suwon]] [[Suwon Baseball Stadium|KT Wiz Park]], chicken.<ref name="hankookilbo_96bb20ad4eb4b04880cf4e4b76d10d9"/><ref name="abcnews_50817262"/>
=== Cheering zones === Each baseball stadium has its sections of unique themed seats.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.asiatoday.co.kr/view.php?key=20150330010018236|title=“이왕이면 명당자리”…프로야구 구장별 베스트 명당|work=종합일간지 : 신문/웹/모바일 등 멀티 채널로 국내외 실시간 뉴스와 수준 높은 정보를 제공|access-date=2017-11-20|language=ko}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://blog.naver.com/no1wooriauction/221050360440|title=(주)신한우리경매 맙소사같은 인생 : 네이버 블로그|website=blog.naver.com|language=ko|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref><ref name="nytimes_2014-11-03"/> [[Incheon]] [[Munhak Baseball Stadium]] has a "T Green Zone", "Happiness Zone", "Skybox Zone", and “[[Barbecue]] Zone.” "T Green Zone" is located on the grassy hillside which is available to set up a tent or lay a mat. This zone is recommended to family audiences because it is not too crowded and there is a kid's park near by. "Happiness Zone" is located at the [[Backstop (baseball)|backstop]] and the seats are equipped with tables. "Barbecue Zone" can accommodate up to 200 people at once. It is Korea’s first stadium to provide fans a way to cook meat while watching baseball. At the store inside the stadium they sell meat and lend grills. "Skybox Zone" is located indoors, so watching baseball game isn't restricted by bad weather. Lastly, there is a “[[Home run|Homerun]] Couple Zone” in the outfield [[bleacher]]<nowiki/>s. Many couples enjoy dating there.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mbcsportsplus.com/news/?mode=view&cate=1&b_idx=99939385.000#07D0|title=<이동섭의 하드아웃> 야구장 사용 설명서: SK행복드림구장 편|last=엠스플뉴스|website=엠스플뉴스|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref>
[[Jamsil Baseball Stadium|Jamsil stadium]]'s "Exciting Zone" allows fans to see players close up, but as this zone is close to the playing field, audiences have to be cautious about safety and borrow a [[helmet]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.kmib.co.kr/article/view.asp?arcid=0008155702|title=잠실야구장 어떻게 달라졌나… 선수 숨소리까지 들려요 ‘익사이팅존’ 생겨|website=news.kmib.co.kr|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref>
[[Suwon]] [[Suwon Baseball Stadium|KT Wiz park]] has a "[[HiteJinro|Hite]] Pub" and "[[PlayStation|Playstation]] Lounge." "Hite Pub" is Korea's first sports pub and the cost of one glass of beer and food is included in the ticket price. In the "[[PlayStation|Playstation]] Lounge" audiences can enjoy the match in the assigned room in which a [[PlayStation|Playstation]] is equipped.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mbcsportsplus.com/news/?mode=view&cate=1&b_idx=99935889.000#07D0|title=<이동섭의 하드아웃> 야구장 사용 설명서: kt위즈파크 편|last=엠스플뉴스|website=엠스플뉴스|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref>
[[Daejeon]] [[Daejeon Hanbat Baseball Stadium|Hanwha Life Insurance Eagles Park]] has an "Outfield Lawn Seat" and "Outfield Fieldbox." At the "Outfield Lawn Seat", audiences can enjoy the game with the feeling of a picnic. The "Outfield Fieldbox" is where audiences can watch the game from seats inside the box.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://sports.donga.com/3/all/20170426/84084679/2|title=한화이글스, ‘스포츠 마케팅 어워드 코리아 2017’프로스포츠구단 부문 대상 : 스포츠동아|website=sports.donga.com|language=ko|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref> [[Busan]] [[Busan Sajik Baseball Stadium|Sajik Stadium]] has a "Rocket Battery Zone." There, people can enjoy the baseball game and camping at the same time, so it is recommended to family fans. These two stadiums both have an "Exciting Zone." This zone is close to the ground so audiences can enjoy the players’ dynamic game. It can be interesting to watch the game at ground eye level, but as many [[foul ball]]<nowiki/>s fly toward the seats, children are not allowed to enter as it could be somewhat dangerous.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.segye.com/newsView/20170416001394|title=입장권·용품 할인 듬뿍… “알뜰하게 스포츠 즐기세요”|last=세계일보|date=2017-04-17|work=입장권·용품 할인 듬뿍… “알뜰하게 스포츠 즐기세요” - 세상을 보는 눈, 글로벌 미디어 - 세계닷컴 -|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref>
"Tigers Family Seat" is most famous at [[Gwangju]] [[Gwangju-Kia Champions Field|Kia Champions Field]]. There are seats and tables for four to six people, so audiences can watch the game comfortably.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.naver.com/main/read.nhn?mode=LSD&mid=sec&sid1=144&oid=117&aid=0002030506|title=KIA타이거즈, 특석 및 가족석 신설|access-date=2017-11-20|language=ko}}</ref> [[Masan]] [[Masan Baseball Stadium|Sports Complex Baseball Stadium]] has the "Dinos Mattress Seat." Audiences can watch the game lying on comfortable mattresses. They can borrow a [[Umbrella|parasol]] and beach towel.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.nocutnews.co.kr/news/4443055|title=NC다이노스 매트리스석 '비치타올' 등 무료 제공|access-date=2017-11-20|language=ko-KR}}</ref> And there is a unique stand made up of wooden decks. It is for family audiences and can accommodate six people. Audiences can party there, and no one complains about making noise.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://sports.mk.co.kr/view.php?no=106471&year=2015|title=NC, 마산구장 좌석…팬 친화적으로 바꾼다|work=mk.co.kr|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref>
== Cheering cultures of each club == The clubs of the Korean professional baseball league each have a unique cheering culture.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://blog.naver.com/junhoo10288/80132349077|title=감염된 테란의 둥지 : 네이버 블로그|website=blog.naver.com|language=ko|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref> Fans of the Lotte Giants use [[newspaper]]<nowiki/>s and orange [[plastic bag]]<nowiki/>s as cheering tools.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.sportsq.co.kr/news/articleView.html?idxno=156084|title=롯데자이언츠 '신문지 응원' 전격 부활, 옛 분위기 살린다 - 스포츠Q(큐)|date=2016-04-18|access-date=2017-12-03|language=ko}}</ref> Newspapers are rolled up and swayed in the air. People wear plastic bags on their heads, some knotted to look like [[Mickey Mouse]] ears. The plastic bags were initially intended to handle garbage, but the supporters started to use them as a cheering tool. The Lotte Giants also have unique [[chant]]s, such as 'Azura' and 'Ma'. 'Azura' is a [[dialect]] word, implying 'yield a foul ball/home run ball to children', and 'Ma' is a dialect for calling children, implying 'throw the ball forward' (used when the pitcher throws to first base to check a runner). In response to 'Ma', supporters of other clubs make a counter-chant such as 'Wa' (a dialect of 'why').<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://m.sports.naver.com/kbaseball/news/read.nhn?oid=003&aid=0008139712|title=비닐봉지 머리에 쓰고 롯데 자이언츠 응원하는 바른정당|website=m.sports.naver.com|language=ko|access-date=2017-12-03}}</ref><ref name="nytimes_2014-11-03"/><ref name="abcnews_50817262"/>
[[Hanwha Eagles]] went through a decline of organized cheering starting in 2009. This led many baseball fans to start cheering for visiting teams. The Hanwha Eagles are trying to figure out how to keep track of the new trends and revitalize their fan base. They started to use Fanbots, a cheering [[robot]] made as part of the social cheering campaign for fans who want to support the team but cannot attend the games in person. Anytime, anywhere, if people upload a cheering message via web or mobile, the message is sent to a Fanbot in real time and to be displayed on the board Fanbot is holding. The Hanwha Eagles are the first club to use Fanbots.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://sports.news.naver.com/general/news/read.nhn?oid=464&aid=0000000055|title=<정우영의 히든클립> 응원 로봇 '팬봇'을 아시나요?|access-date=2017-12-03|language=ko}}</ref><ref name="nytimes_2014-11-03"/>
The biggest feature of the [[Doosan Bears]] is that there are many fans who go cheering at [[away game]]s. In addition, the percentage of female audience members is high. In the 2015 season, the percentage of female audiences was 43 percent for all teams, while for the Doosan Bears, it was 53 percent. For this reason, Doosan Bears is the only team in the league to have separate parts for the male and female in cheering songs.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://blog.naver.com/junhoo10288/80132349077|title=감염된 테란의 둥지 : 네이버 블로그|website=blog.naver.com|language=ko|access-date=2017-12-11}}</ref>
The [[Kia Tigers|KIA Tigers]] have their base in [[Gwangju]], so they have many fans in [[Jeolla Province|Jeolla-do]]. They support the team regardless of their performance. The [[LG Twins|LG]] fans are similar in this regard. The official Kia Tigers team color is red but they use yellow balloon sticks for cheering. Some fans call the yellow balloon sticks a '[[pickled radish]]'.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://m.sports.naver.com/kbaseball/news/read.nhn?oid=003&aid=0008249949|title='최강 기아'|website=m.sports.naver.com|language=ko|access-date=2017-12-04}}</ref>
== Globalization == Korea’s baseball cheering culture has been observed to be spreading to other nations.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/korean-baseball-team-fans-phone-cheer_us_5638d1fce4b00a4d2e0bdbcc|title=Korean Baseball Fans’ Coordinated Cheer Puts America To Shame|last=Spies-Gans|first=Juliet|date=2015-11-03|work=Huffington Post|access-date=2017-12-12|language=en-US}}</ref> The fight song for [[Eric Thames]] is one example.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.sportsq.co.kr/news/articleView.html?idxno=235805|title=테임즈 응원가 밀워키 상륙, 한국야구 문화 'MLB 진출' - 스포츠Q(큐)|date=2017-05-03|access-date=2017-11-20|language=ko}}</ref> Thames, who had been a member of Korea's [[Changwon]] [[NC Dinos]] (2014–2016), returned to U.S. [[Major League Baseball]] with the [[Milwaukee Brewers]] in 2017. His Korean theme song was played when he came to bat for Milwaukee. The song resounded through the Milwaukee stadium. His teammates, who did not know about the idea of personal fight songs, showed interest and hummed its melody.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.newsis.com/view/?id=NISX20170430_0014865133&cID=10522&pID=10500|title=[MLB]테임즈 맹활약에 NC 시절 응원가도 수출 조짐|last=NEWSIS|website=newsis|language=ko|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.kukinews.com/news/article.html?no=492602|title=밀워키 브루어스 “KBO팬, 테임즈 잊지 않았다”|website=www.kukinews.com|language=ko|access-date=2017-11-20}}</ref>
== Challenges ==
=== Crisis === Recently the issue of [[copyright]] for [[Fight song|club]] chants or fight songs has emerged.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lawtimes.co.kr/Legal-News/Legal-News-View?serial=120079|title=프로야구 응원가 ‘저작권 침해’… 법정으로 가나|date=2017-08-10|access-date=2017-12-04}}</ref> Clubs want to make their song legitimate and are negotiating with the original copyright holders to use the fight songs familiar to the fans, but as the legal wrangling is ongoing, the clubs have either made some changes to the songs or used the songs without license to do so. The copyright owners for the original songs have prepared [[class action]] lawsuits.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.tvchosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2017/07/27/2017072790021.html|title=[이슈 진단] 야구 응원가 저작권 침해 '심각'…이젠 짚고 넘어갈 때|access-date=2017-12-04|language=ko}}</ref>
Traditionally, the fight songs of each club were created without thought to the original copyright holder. The song would be [[Arrangement|altered]] by changing the lyrics, but this violates the author's [[intellectual property]]. South Korean copyright law largely protects both the author's [[property rights]] and [[moral rights]]. Property rights refer to the rights to the media that is owned by the creators. Usually, content producers are paid for allowing others to use their creation. Moral rights in South Korea are related to the issue of the creator's psychological profit. This includes the right to maintain the identity of the content. This means that anyone using the author's creation must not change its original form. However, the clubs usually modify the original lyrics or tune. Therefore, even though the clubs often pay a large sum for the author's property rights, the fight songs violate the author's moral rights.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.lec.co.kr/news/articleView.html?idxno=44062|title=신종범 변호사의 법정이야기(76) - 응원가와 저작인격권 - 법률저널|date=2017-04-14|access-date=2017-12-04|language=ko}}</ref>
=== Criticism === Korea's baseball cheering culture is largely considered to be positive, but some issues have arisen over the course of its development. First is the "Azura Culture", the cheering culture of the [[Lotte Giants]]. This culture is semi-coercive rather than voluntary. Initially, this culture began with the expectation that if adult spectators pass a foul or home run ball to a child, the conflicts between the adults to get the ball might decrease. This culture also has the purpose of presenting a child with a good memory of watching a baseball game.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.sbs.co.kr/news/endPage.do?news_id=N1004189808&plink=ORI&cooper=NAVER|title=프로야구 롯데의 응원 문화 '아주라'…훈훈 VS 민폐|date=2017-05-11|work=SBS NEWS|access-date=2017-12-04|language=ko-KR}}</ref>
However, in the coercive atmosphere, there are a few audiences with bad manners who take the ball away from the teenagers. As a result, there is a growing criticism about whether "Azura Culture" is truly a good one. There is an ongoing debate online. Some even refer to "Azura Culture" as "robbery in the baseball stadium". As people give the ball to the child before shouting "Azura", the excitement of shouting it is decreasing.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.kmib.co.kr/article/view.asp?arcid=0010472408&code=61161111&cp=nv|title='어우, 진짜 극혐!' 아주라 논쟁 촉발한 외국녀 영상|website=news.kmib.co.kr|access-date=2017-12-04}}</ref>
Recently, other criticisms have been raised. Boisterous cheering culture makes watching the baseball game more joyful, but for some people who want to watch the game quietly, it is annoying. Residents neighboring the ballpark also suffer from the noise. Residents living in the apartment near [[Gwangju-Kia Champions Field|Kia Champions Field Ball Park]] sued [[Gwangju]] city and the [[Kia Tigers|Kia Tigers club]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news1.kr/articles/?3084354|title=국내 첫 야구장 소음·빛 피해소송 내달 7일 변론 재개|date=2017-08-27|work=뉴스1|access-date=2017-12-04|language=ko}}</ref> As Korea's [[Baseball park|ballparks]] are located near very populated regions, it seems to be necessary to resolve the conflict between local residents and the baseball field.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.yonhapnews.co.kr/bulletin/2016/05/04/0200000000AKR20160504092300054.HTML|title=야구장 야간조명에 "눈부셔 못살겠다" 고통 호소|last=박철홍|date=2016-05-08|work=연합뉴스|access-date=2017-12-04|language=ko-KR}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|refs= <ref name="nytimes_2014-11-03">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/11/03/world/asia/to-understand-korean-baseball-head-to-the-stands.html|title=In Korean Baseball, Louder Cheers and More Squid|last=Sang-Hun|first=Choe|date=2014-11-02|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-12-12|language=en-US|issn=0362-4331}}</ref> <ref name="abcnews_50817262">{{Cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/inside-south-korean-baseballs-elaborate-cheer-culture/story?id=50817262|title=A look inside South Korean baseball's elaborate 'cheer culture'|last=News|first=A. B. C.|date=2017-11-01|website=ABC News|access-date=2017-12-12}}</ref> <ref name="hankookilbo_96bb20ad4eb4b04880cf4e4b76d10d9">{{Cite news|url=http://www.hankookilbo.com/v/e96bb20ad4eb4b04880cf4e4b76d10d9|title=힐만 버거ㆍ민우 바나나… 난 요거 먹으러 야구장 간다|work=한국일보|access-date=2017-11-20|language=ko}}</ref> }}

The '''Brittle Books Program''' is an initiative carried out by the [[National Endowment for the Humanities]] at the request of the United States Congress. The initiative began officially between 1988 and 1989 with the intention to involve the eventual [[microform|microfilming]] of over 3 million endangered volumes.
== Purpose == In the beginning half of the 20th century it became apparent that the use of acidic [[wood-pulp paper]], common since the 1850s, was causing paper materials to slowly burn. This has been referred to as the [[slow fire]]. A statement submitted to the House of Representatives estimated that there were 80 million brittle books in North American libraries, 12 million of which were unique titles. As [[mass deacidification]] efforts proved costly and inconsistent, librarians and archivists began looking for more practical ways to preserve the intellectual content of the decaying material. Microfilm, one of the most stable and durable mediums around at the time, was decided to be the most reasonable alternative.
== Timeline == *1987 - A subcommittee of the House of Representatives during the 100th Congress (1st session) addressed the problem of "brittle books in our nation's libraries." *March 17, 1988 - [[Patricia Battin]], president of the Commission on Preservation and Access (CPA), testified before the U.S. House of Representatives' Subcommittee on Interior and Related Agencies (Committee on Appropriations). She proposed a collaborative approach to the preservation of the nation's brittle books and asked the House to increase federal funding for preservation microfilming.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.nhalliance.org/testimony/1988/88testimony-pbattin.html# |title=NHA Testimony: Patricia M. Battin, 17 March 1988<!-- Bot generated title --> |access-date=2007-06-10 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070801104707/http://www.nhalliance.org/testimony/1988/88testimony-pbattin.html# |archive-date=2007-08-01 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> *October, 1988 - An appropriations bill for fiscal year 1989 gave the [[National Endowment for the Humanities]] $12.5 million. Eight million dollars of that sum went to instituting a twenty-year program for the microfilming of endangered volumes.<ref>[http://www.neh.gov/whoweare/timeline.html Timeline<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> *1995 - The program was assessed to be on schedule and 25% complete.{{Citation needed|reason=who assessed the program?|date=August 2009}} *Roughly 50,000 brittle and endangered volumes are microfilmed each year. <ref>[http://www.neh.gov/news/report97/preserv.html Preservation and Access<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> <ref>[http://www.neh.gov/news/report98/preserv.htm Division of Preservation and Access<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> <ref>[http://www.neh.gov/news/report99/preserv.htm Division of Preservation and Access<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> <ref>[http://www.neh.gov/news/report2000/preserv.html Division of Preservation and Access<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> <ref>[http://www.neh.gov/news/report2001/preserv.html aR2001-Division of Preservation and Access<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
==Important figures== [[William Barrow (chemist)|William Barrow]] was a pioneer conservator in the [[library science]] field. He connected the paper strength or lack thereof (brittle paper)to the acidity of the groundwood used to make [[wood pulp]] after the 1850s.<ref name="paper">.{{cite web |author1=Timoth Barrett |author2=Cynthia Mosier |year=1994 |url=http://aic.stanford.edu/sg/bpg/annual/v13/bp13-02.html|title=The Role of Gelatin in Paper Permanency II|publisher=American Institute for Conservation.}}The Book and Paper Annual vol.13</ref> With his own observations of his collection and tests conducted, he announced to the library community that acid deterioration begins to show signs after 20,40 and 80 years.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Barrow|first1=William J.|title=Permanence/Durability of the book-VI: Spot testing for unstable modern book and record papers.|date=1969|publisher=W. J.Barrow Research Laboratory, Inc|page=11|url=http://eric.ed.gov/?id=ED031265|accessdate=30 June 2016}}</ref>
== Structure == As with other [[National Endowment for the Humanities]] programs, the Brittle Books Program is a partnership program, meaning that qualifying institutions must apply for grants in order to participate. Should the institution be accepted, they are required to share at least 33% of the program's costs. Unlike other [[National Endowment for the Humanities]] preservation funding initiatives, the Brittle Books program does require that an institution in each state must be awarded a grant. The projects are largely run at the state level with the [[National Endowment for the Humanities]] providing methodologies, assuring a standard level of quality, and connecting the efforts of the various institutions. To be awarded a grant as part of the Brittle Books Program, institutions were required to abide by five basic conditions: *1. That they abide by the national standard *2. That they create three copies of all material: a master negative, a print negative, and a service copy *3. That a record adhering to national standards be entered into a national bibliographic database *4. That interlibrary loan copies be readily available *5. That storage conditions meet that of the national standard<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.nhalliance.org/testimony/1995/95testimony-pbattin.html# |title=NHA Testimony: Patricia M. Battin, 31 March 1995<!-- Bot generated title --> |access-date=2007-05-01 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070920004724/http://www.nhalliance.org/testimony/1995/95testimony-pbattin.html# |archive-date=2007-09-20 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref>
== Preservation issues ==
===Deacidification=== While there is a deacidification<ref>[[Mass deacidification]]</ref> method that can successfully lower the acidity in brittle books, many public libraries do not have the funding to implement standard programs to halt the deterioration taking place in these institutions. Some repositories have the resources to send books for a deacidification wash in stages.
Deacidification washes are usually a viable option for most repositories as books can be sent in bulk; however, only books of excellent physical quality may be sent. The wash process is rather aggressive and any deformities in a book may cause damage to already brittle specimens. Therefore, libraries would have to first repair those books in less than desirable condition - specifically elements of the binding, leaf attachments, and text attachments - before deacidification. These extra conservation efforts would increase the costs of deacidification.
===Paper splitting=== Another option to preserve brittle books is to perform [[paper splitting]].<ref>[https://www.loc.gov/preserv/papertreng.html MDEP Paper Strengthening Pilot Program 2003-2005 (Preservation, Library of Congress)<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080526155014/http://www.loc.gov/preserv/papertreng.html |date=May 26, 2008 }}</ref> This process dissects a book by its leaf and text attachment and treats each sheet of paper individually. Supervised by a book conservator, a paper conservator, and a conservation specialist, pages are literally pulled apart - fronts from backs - and a piece of alkaline paper is placed in between. The acid pages are then sandwiched back together with a non-acid buffer between them to slow the deterioration process. However, only ZFB (the Zentrum für Bucherhaltung)<ref>[http://www.zfb.com/en_version.php Mass Deacidification and Conservation for Libraries, Archives and Museums from one source<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> offers this procedure (also called mechanical paper splitting). They claim the process is so refined, they have successfully split cigarette paper. Washes will de-acidify the paper though they will remain brittle; but paper splitting increases the strength and flexibility of the paper via the extra new sheet of buffered paper and the ZFB process includes de-acidification washes.<ref>Brückle, I. and Dambrogio, J.[http://aic.stanford.edu/jaic/articles/jaic39-03-001_indx.html "Paper splitting: History and modern technology"] "[[Journal of the American Institute for Conservation]]", 2000. Retrieved on 2008-02-06.</ref><ref>Bansa, H. and Ishii, R. [https://www.uni-muenster.de/Forum-Bestandserhaltung/downloads/pfest-bansa.pdf "The Effect of Different Strengthening Methods on Different Kinds of Paper"]. "[[Restaurator]]", 1997. Retrieved on 2008-02-06.</ref><ref>Liers, L., Wächter, W., and Müller, G. "Results of the paper splitting process." "[[Restaurator]]",1996.</ref>
===Microform=== Microform is a reasonable option for Brittle Book preservation mainly because microfilm can be usable for 500 years, so long as it is stored in proper conditions and a microfilm reader is accessible. Even [[microform|microfiche]] is easier to store than microfilm, provided organizational practices prevent the divestment of sheets from their filing system. Despite its proven record of durability, microform is no longer a preferred method of digitization because it lacks the accessibility that modern electronic digitization provides.
===Digitization=== Digital conversion of physical items is the preferred method, despite an estimated five-year longevity for most computer files. As proper archival-quality digitization requires use of large, uncompressed [[TIFF]] files, storage can be a significant cost, especially for public libraries. Moreover, copyright law restrains the ability to digitize all brittle books. While the library is authorized to make a copy of a book it cannot obtain through reasonable means, having a digital copy offers the possibility of unauthorized distribution if circulated in this format.<ref>[http://palimpsest.stanford.edu/byauth/oakley/brittle.html Copyright and Preservation-Brittle Books Preservation<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
===Photocopies=== Many repositories, such as the University of Kansas,<ref>[http://www.lib.ku.edu/preservation/BrittleBooks.shtml KU Libraries: Brittle Books Program<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080723190614/http://www.lib.ku.edu/preservation/BrittleBooks.shtml |date=July 23, 2008 }}</ref> opt for preservation-quality photocopies. A list-serv<ref>[http://www.lib.ku.edu/preservation/Brittle.shtml KU Libraries: Brittle Books Program<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060903072543/http://www.lib.ku.edu/preservation/Brittle.shtml |date=September 3, 2006 }}</ref> is utilized for the posting of titles so a consortium of libraries can benefit from a reduced cost in replication so they may maintain their circulating collections. Maintained by OCLC, the submissions are processed at the OCLC Preservation Service Center and OCLC retains the digital copies produced as to defer any copyright issues away from the repositories subscribing to the service.
== Future == As libraries move into the digital era, preservation practices attempt to move with them. Current and future projects in preserving brittle volumes are more likely to involve scanning and digitization than microfilming. A recent example of such a program is the ''Digitizing America's Imprints'' project at the [[Library of Congress]] which received a $2 million grant in 2007.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.usatoday.com/tech/news/2007-02-01-digitizing-brittle-books_x.htm | work=USA Today | title=A $2M grant will digitize brittle books | date=2007-02-01 | accessdate=2010-04-27}}</ref>
== Further information == *''Slow Fires: On the Preservation of the Human Record'', a film by Terry Sanders<ref>[http://www.clir.org/pubs/film/film.html CLIR Films<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> *Turning to Dust<ref>[http://www.mla.org/resources/documents/rep_preserving_collections/repview_preservingcol/preserving_col4 Responses to the Preservation Challenge<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070817042856/http://www.mla.org/resources/documents/rep_preserving_collections/repview_preservingcol/preserving_col4 |date=August 17, 2007 }}</ref> *''[[Double Fold|Double Fold: Libraries and the Assault on Paper]]'', a book by [[Nicholson Baker]]
==References== {{reflist}}

'''Caleb Jefferson McNulty''' (December, 1816 – July 12, 1846) was an American lawyer, newspaper editor and politician. Active in the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]], he became [[Clerk of the U.S. House of Representatives]]; while serving in this post he was alleged to have embezzled congressional funds; some charges were subsequently dismissed, and he was acquitted of the others. [[John Quincy Adams]], then serving as a [[Whig Party (United States)|Whig]] member of the House, referred to the charges as a "memorable development of Democratic [[defalcation]]."<ref>''Memoirs of John Quincy Adams, his diary from 1795 to 1848'', Charles Francis Adams, ed., Philadelphia, J.B. Lippincott & Co., © 1877, Vol. 12, p. 148 (entry for January 17, 1845)</ref>
==Early life== Born in [[West Middletown, Pennsylvania|West Middletown]], [[Washington County, Pennsylvania]], McNulty graduated from [[Washington & Jefferson College|Jefferson College]], and moved to [[Zanesville, Ohio]], and then to [[Mount Vernon, Ohio|Mount Vernon]]. He practiced law, worked as editor of the ''Democratic Banner'' newspaper, and became active in politics as a Democrat. McNulty served as Clerk of the [[Ohio House of Representatives]], and was subsequently elected to the House himself.
On December 6, 1843, McNulty was elected by the members of the U.S. House to serve as their Clerk, defeating incumbent [[Matthew St. Clair Clarke]] of Pennsylvania.<ref>''History of Washington County, Pennsylvania with biographical sketches of many of its pioneers and prominent men'', Boyd Crumrine, ed., Philadelphia H.L. Everts & Co., 1882, p. 676</ref><ref>''Biographical Directory of the United States Congress 1774-2005'', Washington, D.C., U.S. Government Printing Office, © 2005, p. 127</ref>
In 1844, he ran for [[U.S. Congress]], and lost to [[Whig Party (United States)|Whig]] candidate [[Columbus Delano]] by only 12 votes.
==Embezzlement charge== On January 17, 1845, a shortage of $45,000 was reported from a U.S. House contingency fund.<ref>Again, ''Memoirs of John Quincy Adams, his diary from 1795 to 1848'', Charles Francis Adams, ed., Philadelphia, J.B. Lippincott & Co., © 1877, Vol. 12, p. 148 (entry for January 17, 1845)</ref> McNulty was dismissed as Clerk, and the House recommended that the [[U.S. Secretary of the Treasury]] institute the necessary legal proceedings to recover the money from McNulty.
During the House investigation, Rep. [[John B. Weller]] produced a document ostensibly showing that McNulty had simply deposited $30,000 of House funds with a New York commercial house. McNulty’s accounting clerk produced documents, including a certificate ostensibly showing that the House had a credit for $29,000 dollars at the bank.<ref>''Memoirs of John Quincy Adams, his diary from 1795 to 1848'', Charles Francis Adams, ed., Philadelphia, J.B. Lippincott & Co., © 1877, Vol. 12, p. 148–150 (entries for January 17 and 18, 1845)</ref> [[Edwin Stanton]] defended McNulty, and succeeded at obtaining dismissal of some charges, and acquittal on the others.<ref>“went to Washington and succeeded in having an indictment against Caleb McNulty, a defaulting clerk of the House of Representatives dismissed, thus saving”, p.27, Joseph Beatty Doyle, ''In memoriam, Edwin McMasters Stanton, his life and work, with an account of dedication of a bronze statue in his native city'', E Book [http://www.ebooksread.com/authors-eng/joseph-beatty-doyle/in-memoriam-edwin-mcmasters-stanton-his-life-and-work-with-an-account-of-dedi-goo/page-3-in-memoriam-edwin-mcmasters-stanton-his-life-and-work-with-an-account-of-dedi-goo.shtm]</ref><ref>[http://www.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~ohjeffer/1890bioindex/emstanton.htm]{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
==Later life== McNulty's reputation in Ohio was largely undamaged. Though he had previously served in the militia and attained the rank of [[Colonel (United States)|colonel]], at the start of the [[Mexican–American War]] he joined the 1st Ohio Volunteer Infantry as a private. He died on a steamship (some sources indicate the ''Alhambra'', others the ''Jamestown'') near [[Helena, Arkansas]] while the regiment was en route to [[New Orleans]] for transport to Mexico.
==Family== McNulty was survived by his wife, Caroline Abbott Converse McNulty, and a one-year-old son named Rob Roy MacGregor McNulty (later, also, Converse), who had been born in Cincinnati in 1844. Caroline McNulty died before Rob Roy McNulty's tenth birthday, leaving him an orphan.
Rob Roy MacGregor McNulty Converse become a nationally prominent [[Episcopal Church (United States)|Episcopal]] priest and U.S. scholar, and a chaplain with the [[Union Army]] during the [[American Civil War]]. He was wounded at the [[Battle of Gettysburg]] and nursed back to health at the [[Mower U.S.A. General Hospital]] in [[Chestnut Hill, Philadelphia]]. Returned to the field for the [[Battle of the Wilderness]], McNulty's brigade was captured by [[Confederate States Army|Confederates]], and he was held as a prisoner of war at [[Andersonville prison|Andersonville]] from May to December, 1864.
After the war Rob Roy McNulty was successively rector of St. John's Church in Waterbury, Connecticut, Christ Church in Corning, New York, and St. Luke’s Church in Rochester, New York. A [[Phi Beta Kappa]] graduate of [[Iowa]]'s [[Griswold College]], he was also a professor of mathematics and science and chaplain at [[Washington and Jefferson College]] and [[Hobart and William Smith Colleges|Hobart College]]. He was also president of the [[Archeological Institute of America]] and a fellow of the [[American Geographical Society]].<ref>''Some of the Ancestors and Descendants of Samuel Converse, Jr.'' (Vol. II) (Ed. Charles Evans Converse). (1905). Boston: Eben Putnam, p. 443 (digitized by Google September 24, 2007)</ref><ref>''Builders of Our Nation'', published annually, "Men of 1913". (1914). Chicago: American Publishers Association, p. 122 (digitized by Google June 6, 2013)</ref><ref>Thomas William Herringshaw, ''The American Blue Book of Biography''. (1913). Chicago: American Publishers Association, p. 183 (digitized by Google April 11, 2011)</ref><ref>''Niles National Register'' newspaper, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania (founder Niles Hezekia, lived 1777-1839) edition archived as NNR 70.343, available digitized by subscription at www.nilesregister.com, also, [http://www.history.vt.edu/MxAmWar/Newspapers/Niles/Nilesc1846AugOct.htm]</ref>

[[File:Даниил.jpg|thumb|The prophet [[Daniel (biblical figure)|Daniel]] from the [[Sistine Chapel ceiling]].]]
According to the theory of the art historian [[Marcia B. Hall]],<ref>{{cite book|last1=Hall|first1=Marcia B.|title=Color and Meaning: Practice and Theory in Renaissance Painting|date=1994|publisher=Cambridge University Press|location=New York, N.Y.|isbn=978-0-521-45733-0}}</ref> which has gained considerable acceptance,<ref>{{cite web|title=Four Canonical Painting Modes by APA|url=http://artpaintingartist.org/the-four-canonical-painting-modes-of-the-renaissance/}}. Retrieved June 18, 2015.</ref> '''''cangiante''''' is one of four modes of painting colours available to Italian [[High Renaissance]] painters, along with [[sfumato]], [[chiaroscuro]] and ''[[unione]]''.<ref>Hall, Marcia B., ''Rome'' (series "Artistic Centers of the Italian Renaissance"), pp.148-150, 2005, Cambridge University Press, 2005, {{ISBN|0521624452}}, 9780521624459, [https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=gt5gtrqoKOIC&pg=PA148 google books]</ref> The word itself derives from the Italian ''cangiare'' ("to change").
''Cangiante'' is characterized by a change in color necessitated by an original color's darkness or lightness limitation. For example, when painting shadows on a yellow object, the artist may use a red color simply because the yellow paint cannot be made dark enough. There are other methods of rendering shadows or highlights (for example, mixing the original hue with black or brown), but these can render the shadow color dull and impure. During the Renaissance, the variety and availability of paint colors were severely limited. [[File:Giotto ArenaChapel Lamentation.jpg|thumb|An early example of cangiante by [[Giotto]] from the [[Scrovegni Chapel|Arena Chapel]]. Note the shift in color on the robes.]] The greatest practitioner of the ''cangiante'' technique was [[Michelangelo]],<ref>Hall, Marcia B., ''Rome'' (series "Artistic Centers of the Italian Renaissance"), pp.148-150, 2005, Cambridge University Press, 2005, {{ISBN|0521624452}}, 9780521624459, [https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=gt5gtrqoKOIC&pg=PA148 google books]</ref> especially in many parts of the [[Sistine Chapel ceiling]]. For example, in the image of the prophet [[Daniel (biblical figure)|Daniel]], a transition from green to yellow is evident in the subject's robes. After Michelangelo's time, the technique found widespread acceptance and is now a standard painting technique.
==See also== *[[Chiaroscuro]] *[[Michelangelo]] *[[Sfumato]] *[[Tenebrism]] *[[Unione]]

{{Refimprove|date=October 2011}} [[Image:China Tibetology Research Center.JPG|thumb|right|China Tibetology Research Center]] The '''China Tibetology Research Center''' ({{zh|c=中国藏学研究中心}}; [[Standard Tibetan|Tibetan]]: ཀྲུང་གོའི་བོད་རིག་པ་ཞིབ་འཇུག་ལྟེ་གནས།; [[Wylie transliteration|Wylie:]] Krung go'i bod rig pa zhib 'jug ste gnas<ref name=":1" />) is an [[academic research]] organization in [[Beijing]], [[People’s Republic of China|China]] devoted to the study of [[Tibet]] ([[Tibetology]]). It studies all aspects of [[Tibet]] including subjects related to everyday life in Tibetan areas (economy, ecology etc.).
==Founding==
The ''China Tibetology Research Center'' was founded in Beijing on May 20, 1986.
==Subdivisions==
Five research institutes comprise the scholarly core of the Chinese Tibetology Research Center. They are:
* Institute for Social and Economic Studies * Institute for History Studies * Institute for Religious Studies * Institute for Contemporary Tibetan Studies * Institute for Tibetan Medicine Studies.
Additionally, the Center also manages the China Tibetology Publishing House, the Kanjur and Tanjur Collation Bureau, the Beijing Tibetan Medical Center, the China Tibetology press and the Center’s Library.
==Activities==
International collaboration and academic exchange are key activities of the Chinese Tibetology Research Center. The Center has successfully held three international [[seminar]]s for Tibetan studies. In 2001, about 220 scholars from 14 countries attended the Beijing International Seminar for Tibetan Studies. Since the year 2000, the Center has hosted about 230 scholars, diplomats and journalists from 40 countries.
==Position on 2008 Tibetan unrest== {{neutrality|reason=Undue emphasis on opinions opposed to the Dalai Lama|date=October 2017}} The regional government of Tibet is quoted: "There has been enough evidence to prove that the recent sabotage in Lhasa was 'organised, premeditated and masterminded' by the Dalai clique," as published by the [[Xinhua News Agency|Xinhua news agency]], citing the Tibet government.{{Citation needed|date=June 2017}}
Maureen Fan of the [[The Washington Post|Washington Post]] on March 27, 2008 wrote, ::"Experts from the government-established China Tibetology Research Center echoed leaders in blaming the Dalai Lama for deliberately sparking the protests to separate Tibet from China and sabotage the Aug. 8-24 [[2008 Summer Olympics|Beijing Olympic]]<nowiki/>s."<ref name=":0" />
:She further wrote of Lhagpa Phuntshogs, General Director of the China Tibetology Research Center that, :::"... even though the [[Lhasa]] riots were 'carefully premeditated and organized' by the [[14th Dalai Lama|Dalai Lama]], he said, 'so long as the Dalai Lama abandons his separatist position, stops all separatist activities and recognizes Tibet and [[Taiwan]] as part of [[China]], the door for consultation and dialogue between him and the central government is always open.' Professor Lian Xiangmin, director of the center's Research Projects Office, responded to a question on whether China is afraid of the Dalai Lama by saying, 'I do not think I said the Dalai is highly violent, and I also believe that so long as 1.3 billion Chinese people are united as one, they will fear no one.' "<ref name=":0">https://web.archive.org/web/20160307045037/http://www.sfgate.com/news/article/Nearly-1-000-give-selves-up-after-riots-China-3222441.php</ref>
In 2016 John Powers wrote about 2008's "[[2008 Tibetan unrest|unprecedented levels of protest]]"<ref name=":1">{{Cite book|title=The Buddha Party: How the People's Republic of China Works to Define and Control Tibetan Buddhism|last=Powers|first=John|publisher=Oxford University Press|year=2016|isbn=9780199358151|location=New York|pages=Appendix B, page 3}}</ref> and that "On March 7, 2009, Wang Xiaobin, a scholar at the China Tibetology Research Centre, told foreign reporters: 'We think the Dalai Lama is the reason for the riots in Tibet... and the Dalai Lama is a card, a chip in a wider diplomatic struggle.... If there was no intervention by the West, there would be no Tibet issue at all. The Tibet issue is a creation of the USA.' "<ref name=":1" />
==See also== *[[Library of Tibetan Works and Archives]] *[[Namgyal Institute of Tibetology]] *[[Norbulingka Institute]]
==References==
<references/>

{{Infobox television | show_name = Codefellas | image = Codefellas title card.png | image_alt = | caption = | genre = [[Political satire]] | creator = [[David Rees (cartoonist)|David Rees]]{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/06/21/codefellas-nsa-animated-series-john-hodgman_n_3478926.html|title=Codefellas: NSA Inspires New Animated Series With John Hodgman, Emily Heller (VIDEO)|publisher=[[The Huffington Post]]|date=21 June 2013|accessdate=2013-06-23}}
[[Brian Spinks]] | based_on = | developer = [[Brian Spinks]] | writer = [[David Rees (cartoonist)|David Rees]], [[Brian Spinks]], [[Bob Powers]] | director = | creative_director = | presenter = | starring = Emily Heller
[[John Hodgman]] | judges = | voices = | narrated = | theme_music_composer = | opentheme = | endtheme = | composer = | country = United States | language = English | num_seasons = 1 | num_episodes = 12{{cite web|author=[[Todd Spangler]]|url=https://variety.com/2013/digital/news/wireds-codefellas-plays-nsa-privacy-flap-for-laughs-1200500482/|title=Wired’s ‘Codefellas’ Plays NSA Privacy Flap for Laughs - Variety|publisher=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=21 June 2013|accessdate=2013-06-23}}{{cite web|author=[[David Haglund]]|url=http://www.slate.com/blogs/browbeat/2013/06/25/codefellas_watch_john_hodgman_spoof_the_nsa_for_wired_video.html|title=Codefellas: Watch John Hodgman spoof the NSA for Wired. (VIDEO)|publisher=[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]]|date=25 June 2013|accessdate=2013-06-26}} | list_episodes = | executive_producer = Robert Green | producer = | editor = | cinematography = | camera = | runtime = | company = | distributor = | network = | picture_format = | audio_format = | first_aired = {{Start date|2013|6|21}} | last_aired = {{End date|2013|12|10}} | related = | website = | production_website = }} '''''Codefellas''''' is an [[United States|American]] [[Animated cartoon|animated]] [[political satire]] [[web series]] starring Emily Heller and [[John Hodgman]] distributed by Wired magazine. It was created by [[David Rees (cartoonist)|David Rees]] {{cite web|author=[[David Rees (cartoonist)|David Rees]]|url=http://www.mnftiu.cc/2013/06/21/codefellas/|title=www.mnftiu.cc » Blog Archive » CODEFELLAS|publisher=[[WordPress]]|date=21 June 2013|accessdate=2013-06-23}} and [[Brian Spinks]] from an idea by Robert Green. == Background == On June 6, 2013, former [[National Security Agency|NSA]] contractor [[Edward Snowden]] leaked the existence of [[PRISM (surveillance program)|PRISM]], an electronic surveillance program intended to monitor e-mail and phone call activity in the United States to identify possible terrorist threats, to the newspapers ''[[The Guardian]]'' and ''[[The Washington Post]]''. [[Condé Nast Publications]], who produces ''Wired'' magazine, said ''Codefellas'' will provide "comedic relief in light of current events dominating the national news cycle." After ''Wired'' joined [[Condé Nast Publications|Condé Nast]]'s Digital Video Network, five original web series were announced for ''Wired'''s video channel including ''Codefellas'' and ''[[Mister Know-It-All]]''.{{cite web|author=[[Erik Hayden]]|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/conde-nast-entertainment-launches-wired-523288|title=Conde Nast Entertainment Launches 'Wired' Video Channel - The Hollywood Reporter|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=15 May 2013|accessdate=2013-06-23}}{{cite web|author=[[Erik Maza]]|url=http://www.wwd.com/media-news/fashion-memopad/digital-days-6916602|title=Condé Entertainment Previews Video Channels for Vogue, Wired and Vanity Fair|work=[[Women's Wear Daily]]|date=2 May 2013|accessdate=2013-06-23}} ''Codefellas'' is ''Wired'''s first scripted series.{{cite web|author=[[Mike Snider]]|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/2013/05/15/wired-magazine-video-series/2160937/|title='Wired' magazine launching new video series|work=[[USA Today]]|date=15 May 2013|accessdate=2013-08-10}} == Production == ''Codefellas'' is scripted by ''[[Get Your War On]]'' cartoonist [[David Rees (cartoonist)|David Rees]] and [[Brian Spinks]], who produced ''Get Your War On'' for ''[[The Huffington Post]]''. [[Flat Black Films]], the animation and software company who worked on the [[Richard Linklater]] films ''[[Waking Life]]'' and ''[[A Scanner Darkly (film)|A Scanner Darkly]]'', worked on the [[rotoscoping]] and [[Lip sync|lipsyncing]].{{cite web|author=[[Jennifer Deutrom]]|url=http://www.jdeutrom.com/essays/10/|title=Animation for Wired magazine, "Codefellas" - jennifer deutrom|publisher=Koken|date=22 June 2013|accessdate=2013-06-29|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150504030329/http://www.jdeutrom.com/essays/10/|archivedate=4 May 2015|df=}} Twelve episodes are planned for ''Codefellas''. The first episode "When Topple Met Winters" premiered on June 21, 2013.{{cite web|author=Camilleri, Ricky|url=http://live.huffingtonpost.com/r/segment/john-hodgman-netflix-special/51c085f52b8c2a0a5000008f|title=John Hodgman LIVE - HuffPost Live|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|date=20 June 2013|accessdate=2013-06-23}} The second episode "Meet Big Data" premiered on June 26, 2013.{{cite web|author=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RA_nM1k5B2g|title=Codefellas EP2: Meet Big Data - WIRED - YouTube|publisher=[[YouTube]]|date=26 June 2013|accessdate=2013-06-26}}{{cite web|author=[[David Rees (cartoonist)|David Rees]]|url=http://www.mnftiu.cc/2013/06/26/codefellas-episode-2/|title=www.mnftiu.cc » Blog Archive » CODEFELLAS, episode 2|publisher=[[WordPress]]|date=26 June 2013|accessdate=2013-06-27}} The third episode "How to Hack a Website" premiered on July 10, 2013.{{cite web|author=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WW6GE-kmP64|title=Codefellas EP3: How to Hack a Website - WIRED - YouTube|publisher=[[YouTube]]|date=10 July 2013|accessdate=2013-07-10}} The fourth episode "The AntiSocial Network" premiered on July 17, 2013.{{cite web|author=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M3gKCMSgZ4k|title=Codefellas EP4: The AntiSocial Network - WIRED - YouTube|publisher=[[YouTube]]|date=17 July 2013|accessdate=2013-07-18}} The fifth episode "Spy vs. Spy" premiered on July 24, 2013.{{cite web|author=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ogJbS84ZhQY|title=Codefellas EP5: Spy vs. Spy - WIRED - YouTube|publisher=[[YouTube]]|date=24 July 2013|accessdate=2013-07-24}} The sixth episode "Blackmail at 4:20" premiered on July 31, 2013.{{cite web|author=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BTMYBmesKn8|title=Codefellas EP6: Blackmail at 4:20- WIRED - YouTube|publisher=[[YouTube]]|date=28 August 2013|accessdate=2013-10-31}} The tenth episode "How to Cheat to Win" premiered on September 4, 2013.{{cite web|author=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DgiQY2V7MNc|title=Codefellas S1 EP 10: How to Cheat to Win-WIRED - YouTube|publisher=[[YouTube]]|date=18 September 2013|accessdate=2013-10-31}} == Story == In the first episode "When Topple Met Winters", protégé hacker Nicole Winters (Emily Heller) who works for "Special Projects", an electronic surveillance governmental agency, receives a call from elderly Special Agent Henry Topple ([[John Hodgman]]) informing her that she has just been assigned to him to spy on the general public. In the second episode "Meet Big Data", Agent Topple checks up on how Winters is settling into her new job at "Special Projects". Topple asks Winters about her surveillance of e-mails and in turn reveals his lack of understanding with modern computing. The conversation then trails off into the secret history of how fake mustaches were involved with the United States' national security. In the third episode "How to Hack a Website", Agent Topple instructs Winters to hack a website. It is revealed that Topple merely used Winters's hacking expertise to remember the password to his old [[GeoCities]] e-mail. After Topple asks what e-mails are in his inbox, Winters finds an urgent message from 1998 on a secret project involving Topple's past partner Logan and a "test subject". In the fourth episode "The AntiSocial Network", Agent Topple calls Winters about a supposed alert from [[PRISM (surveillance program)|PRISM]] on a [[Cyberterrorism|cyberterrorist]] group called "[[Evite]]" infiltrating their networks and a subsequent attack. In the course of conversation, it is revealed that it is only an invitation from Topple's co-worker Doug for his retirement party described as a "big blow-out." Blaming the terror alert from PRISM on boredom, Winters brings up [[Facebook]], a social network. Topple then calls Facebook "the smartest way to keep people dumb since we started [[Water fluoridation controversy|fluoridating the water]]." Winters then admonishes Topple for having her to have to fill out a "88-J" incident form because of revealing classified information so candidly. Since "88-J" incident forms are only filled out by supervisors, Topple realizes Winters was promoted to become Topple's superior. In the fifth episode "Spy vs. Spy", Winters calls Topple back since she was busy with a briefing. As Topple was not invited to the meeting, he passed the time watching [[telenovela]]s. Winters complains about his unprofessionalism and reveals that she had not slept well because of a list of troubles the night before. It turns out that the troubles were all perpetrated by Topple's ability to use national security at his disposal as he is still upset over Winters's recent promotion. In the sixth episode "Blackmail at 4:20", Topple finds his personal accounts with [[Walgreens]], [[Amtrak]], [[MCI Communications|MCI]], and so forth have been hacked because of Winters. In retaliation, Topple orders a "toilet water sample" and finds that Winters is a drug user, which is grounds for termination. Coming to a compromise, Winters discloses to Topple her secret project: stopping a North Korean computer virus. Per their agreement, Topple gets to collaborate with Winters on the secret project as well as getting full credit for it. In the seventh episode "25 Reasons the NSA Should Hire Buzzfeed Staffers", Topple sends Winters a fax of his analysis of the North Korean computer virus called "[[Stuxnet|Staxnut]]". As the two converse on the computer virus, it is revealed that the computer virus could replace all American digital content with North Korean [[flagging dance|flag dancing]]. Given that North Korea is busy producing flags, there is still time to stop the virus. However, Topple realizes it would wipe out electronic dance music (and other media) he loathes and thus realizes his dilemma. In the eighth episode "How to Kill Your Boss", Winters informs Topple that she called Chief Deputy Rollins and that Rollins does not want Topple on the Staxnut project. Annoyed that he is not involved with the project, Topple lists off the people he has killed. In the course of the conversation, Winters receives an alert that the Chief Deputy was murdered. == Reception == [[File:Codefellas Episode 1 Screenshot.png|thumb|right|Agent Henry Topple ([[John Hodgman]]) getting in touch with "Special Projects" Nicole (Emily Heller).]] === Commercial === As of June 26, 2013, ''Codefellas'''s first episode "When Topple Met Winters" has garnered "more than 266,000 views."{{cite web|author=[[Sam Gutelle]]|url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2013/06/26/wired-codefellas-david-rees-john-hodgman/|title=Wired's 'Codefellas' Web Series Rips NSA Scandal From The Headlines|publisher=[[Tubefilter]]|date=26 June 2013|accessdate=2013-06-26}} === Critical === [[Cory Doctorow]] of ''[[Boing Boing]]'' called ''Codefellas'' "pretty promising stuff!"{{cite web|author=[[Cory Doctorow]]|url=http://boingboing.net/2013/06/21/wiredjohn-hodgman-animated-se.html|title=Wired/John Hodgman animated series about NSA spooks - Boing Boing|publisher=[[Boing Boing]]|date=21 June 2013|accessdate=2013-06-23}} Eike Kühl of ''[[Die Zeit]]'' said the first two episodes "shine primarily by the bizarre dialogues of unequal protagonists."{{cite web|author=[[Eike Kühl]]|url=http://blog.zeit.de/netzfilmblog/2013/06/27/codefellas-wired-webserie-prism-nsa/|title=Webserie "Codefellas" nimmt Überwachung auf die Schippe « Netzfilmblog|publisher=[[Die Zeit]]|date=27 June 2013|accessdate=2013-06-27}} Kate Hutchinson and Gwilym Mumford of ''[[The Guardian]]'' called ''Codefellas'' "very odd" citing "it acts well as an accompaniment to the more hyperactive comedy of ''[[Archer (2009 TV series)|Archer]]''."{{cite web|author=[[Kate Hutchinson]] & [[Gwilym Mumford]]|url=https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2013/jul/27/catch-up-tv-guide|title=Catch-up TV guide: from Luther to Comran's Drive-In|publisher=[[The Guardian]]|date=26 July 2013|accessdate=2013-07-27}} [[Charlie Anders]] of ''[[io9]]'' called ''Codefellas'' "ridiculously funny."{{cite web|author=[[Charlie Anders]]|url=http://io9.com/the-nsa-spying-scandal-as-explained-by-pixar-757650604|title=The NSA Spying Scandal, as Explained by Pixar|publisher=[[io9]]|date=12 July 2013|accessdate=2013-07-25}} E. D. W. Lynch of ''[[Laughing Squid]]'' called ''Codefellas'' "hilarious."{{cite web|author=[[EDW Lynch]]|url=http://laughingsquid.com/codefellas-hilarious-animated-series-about-the-nsa-starring-john-hodgman/|title=Codefellas, Hilarious Animated Series About the NSA Starring John Hodgman|publisher=[[Laughing Squid]]|date=25 June 2013|accessdate=2013-06-26}} [[Sherwin Siy]], VP of legal affairs for consumer advocacy group [[Public Knowledge]], took issue with the premise saying "It’d be a shame if people started to view pervasive government surveillance as another laughable daily chore, like traffic or boring meetings. On the other hand, it’s entirely possible for good comedy to poke at and explore sensitive and enraging issues." David Haglund of ''[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]]'' said "I'm looking forward to the rest." Bradford Evans of ''[[Splitsider]]'' called ''Codefellas'' "a fast, funny comedy that does for domestic spying what ''Archer'' does for international espionage."{{cite web|author=[[Bradford Evans]]|url=http://splitsider.com/2013/07/check-out-wireds-new-animated-web-series-codefellas-featuring-john-hodgman-and-emily-heller/|title=Check Out Wired's New Animated Web Series 'Codefellas,' Featuring John Hodgman and Emily Heller|publisher=[[Splitsider]]|date=12 July 2013|accessdate=2013-07-12}} Sam Gutelle of ''[[Tubefilter]]'' praised ''Codefellas'' as "somewhere between
